In flux_desugar::desugar::env

?

Struct flux_desugar::desugar::env::Env

source · 
pub(crate) struct Env<P> {
    scopes: FxHashMap<ScopeId, Scope<P>>,
    parent: FxHashMap<ScopeId, ScopeId>,
    children: FxHashMap<ScopeId, FxHashSet<ScopeId>>,
    root: ScopeId,
    curr: ScopeId,
}
Expand description

The environment used for desugaring that tracks parameter names and shadowing. An environment is a tree formed by nested scopes.

Fields§

§scopes: FxHashMap<ScopeId, Scope<P>>§parent: FxHashMap<ScopeId, ScopeId>§children: FxHashMap<ScopeId, FxHashSet<ScopeId>>§root: ScopeId§curr: ScopeId

source§

impl<P> Env<P>

source

pub(crate) fn new(root: ScopeId) -> Self

source

pub(crate) fn insert( &mut self, sess: &FluxSession, ident: Ident, param: P ) -> Result<(), ErrorGuaranteed>

Inserts a parameter in the current scope, returning an error if a parameter with the same name is already in the scope.

source

pub(crate) fn extend( &mut self, sess: &FluxSession, params: impl IntoIterator<Item = (Ident, P)> ) -> Result<(), ErrorGuaranteed>

Extends the current scope with a list of parameters reporting an error if there are any dupliates.

source

pub(crate) fn get(&self, ident: Ident) -> Option<&P>

fn find_map<'a, T>( &'a self, f: impl FnMut(ScopeId, &'a Scope<P>) -> Option<T> ) -> Option<T>

source

pub(crate) fn get_mut(&mut self, ident: Ident) -> Option<&mut P>

source

pub(crate) fn scope(&mut self, id: ScopeId) -> &mut Scope<P>

source

pub(crate) fn push(&mut self, id: ScopeId)

Push a scope with id as a child of the current scope and then enters the new scope. The id must be different from any scope already in the environment.

Panics

Panics if id is already in the enrvionment

source

pub(crate) fn pop(&mut self) -> Scope<P>

Remove the current scope and return it. Then set the current scope to the parent scope.

Panics

Panics if the current scope has children.

source

pub(crate) fn enter(&mut self, scope: ScopeId)

Enter a child scope.

Panics

Panics if scope is not a child of the current scope.

source

pub(crate) fn exit(&mut self)

Exit the current scope back into the parent scope.

Panics

Panics if the current scope is the root scope.

source

pub(crate) fn filter_map<T>(self, f: impl FnMut(P, bool) -> Option<T>) -> Env<T>

source

fn curr(&mut self) -> &mut Scope<P>

source

pub(crate) fn root(&mut self) -> &mut Scope<P>

source

pub(crate) fn into_root(self) -> Scope<P>

Calls U::from(self).

That is, this conversion is whatever the implementation of From<T> for U chooses to do.
